_kv_rules.description: the minimum percentage of armour roll that can be applied
this is the max valued that is allowed for the armour roll. If set to -1 there will be no maximum.
this is the min valued that is allowed for the armour roll. If set to -1 there will be no minimum.
How much times the cap to the interval between two subsequent melee or missile attacks gets multiplied in the event that the entity gets knocked back or knocked down.
the maximum distance the camera can move from the player's army
Cost multiplier for moving through these pipe types (PT_WALL_CLIMB, PT_DESTROYED_WALL_CLIMB, PT_WOOD_WALL_CLIMB, PT_DESTROYED_WOOD_WALL_CLIMB, PT_CLIMB_LADDER)
Default cost multiplier for moving through pipes not specified explicitly in this table
Cost multiplier for moving through these pipe types (PT_JUMP, PT_JUMP_RAMP, PT_JUMP_ANIM)
Cost multiplier for moving through this pipe type (PT_JUMP_DISEMBARK)
Cost multiplier for moving through this pipe type (PT_SHIP_GRAPPLE)
Cost multiplier for moving through this pipe type (PT_WALL_DOOR) when owned by siege tower
Cost multiplier for moving through this pipe type (PT_WALL_DOOR)

If ( defensive AI's non-tower CP / attacking army's total CP ) - ( (defensive AI's total CP - attacking army's ranged CP) / defensive AI's total CP ) is > this value, the AI will Sally Out because the attacker's missile strength is too great to withstand.
If the defensive AI's army strength is this times greater than the attacking army strength, the AI will Sally Out of a settlement
Approximate combat potential for a defensive tower, used by the AI to determine when to Sally Out of a settlement
max distance in metres that can exist between two slots when occupying zones
Using bayonets increases the attack stat of a unit
Using Ring bayonets increases the time needed to reload the musket/carbine
The amount of HP damage we have to do to trigger beserk. (Relative to our unit numbers)
The amount of battle ticks idle before berserk times out.
Multiplied distance from the front of the gate which will cause damage to units from oil
Number of seconds the boiling oil flows for between intervals
half-angle, where an entity can be considered as braced to apply a braced mass multiplier to collision damage
half-angle, where a bracing entity will perform a bracing attack vs an incoming charger
Number of ranks at which full bracing multiplier is applied. Beyond this number, bracing multiplier will be clamped.
The full bracing multiplier applied at calibration ranks. Multiplier decreases linearly to 1.0 at rank = 1.
Additonal bracing bonus (multiplied to mass) for charge reflectors
The braced mass (i.e. after multiplying by bracing multiplier) beyond which an entity cannot be push around by small entities with soft collision.
Global max clamp on bracing multiplier after all mulitplier are applied, e.g. from special abilities.
A timer that disables collision for the specified time when an entity that is breaking off collides with an enemy entity.
Enables speed and direction checks for entity breaking off. Enabling this makes breaking off more sticky.
time over which to fade out charge bonus after charge complete
speed modifier for ladder climbing - fast speed
speed modifier for wall climbing - fast speed
ratio of damage that ignores armour
collision damage dealt if no attacker is identified
Collision damage immunity timer from the same attacker
collision damage cap
(collision_power^collision_damage_normaliser) * collision_damage_modifier
(collision_power^collision_damage_normaliser) * collision_damage_modifier
Delay before disabling collision on an enemy entity in a knocked back interrupt animation
Delay before disabling collision on a friendly entity in a knocked back interrupt animation
Delay before disabling collision on an enemy entity in a knocked down interrupt animation
Delay before disabling collision on a friendly entity in a knocked down interrupt animation
Delay before disabling collision on an enemy entity in a knocked flying interrupt animation
Delay before disabling collision on a friendly entity in a knocked flying interrupt animation
Distance to scan for obstacles to see if collision should be disabled. This is for entites bigger than the value set in collision_disable_death_max_entity_size.
Fade out alpha to use when collision is disabled for entities bigger than the value set in collision_disable_death_max_entity_size
Entities of this size or smaller always disable collision when dead. 0-VS 1-S 2-M 3-L 4-VL.
Coefficient of restitution for entity collision physics
instantaneous speed delta to trigger a knocked back interrupt
instantaneous speed delta to trigger a knocked down interrupt
instantaneous speed delta to trigger a knocked flying interrupt
instantaneous speed delta to trigger a step back interrupt
The default number of obstacles (toggleable buildings) can enable in battle
Sets how far down the pivot point is from the front of the formation. 0 = pivot from the front, 1 = pivot from the back
Multiplicative modifier to melee attack interval on easy for the AI only
Multiplicative modifier to melee attack interval on hard for the AI only
Multiplicative modifier to melee attack interval on very hard for the AI only
If a hill is over this distance away, it will not be considered

The mutliplier to use to modify the attack interval and damage done from a regular unit entity against a hero entity. So e.g. if this is 2.0, we double the attack interval and attack damage so the dps will remain the same but the entities will attack the hero less. (default 1.0 - no change)
Separation in metres between the entity formation slots
Time (in seconds) before entity will track correctly after starting movement
Health of buildings for custom battle in escalation level 1
Health of buildings for custom battle in escalation level 2
Whether the fire damage applies only to siege equipment or to all entities (chariots, engines, etc.)
This increases (linearly) the initial delay to aiming, the poorer the training of the unit
In fort battles, the walls give a perimeter visibility for the defender.
The distance the defender can see from unmanned fort walls.
Ratio of players starting score/strenth that is awarded for being the last remaining player
When the percentage of alive entities in the general's unit is above this value the general cannot be killed.
The chance of a hero being dismounted when charging against a charge reflector/negator
Time allowed to respond to a duel proposition from another player/ai. After this time has elapsed, a default option will be choosen (Accept).
0 - False 1 - True. If we allow a "free" attack when the missed attack limit is reached, this will ignore the block total but ensures the duel doesnt become stale with all blocks and no hits

The amount to decay the block chance when performing a block in place of an attack. Once this chance reaches 0, an attack can be played without a responding block. Formula for calculating the decrease when blocking - hero_duel_blocking_decay_modifier * (attacker__m_damage / defender_m_damage)

This value multiplied by the entities melee defence with decide the starting blocking total. So if 10 and melee defence is 10 then the entity will have a max total of 100. Every attack the entity could hit with will change to a miss so the opponent will block, if this value is > 0. When this is the case, the value will decay
0 - False 1 - True. If we use the extra blocks system for duels
The max number of attacks to cache when we play a block/miss instead of hit. The number of cached attacks will be multiplied by the damage done when a succesfull attack lands. -1 means no limit

Used to calculate the recovery per tick. Formula - (melee_defence / hero_duel_blocking_defence_modifier) * hero_duel_blocking_recovery_modifier. If the recovery value per tick resolves to be too high (greater than the decay rate), then the entity may never be allowed to land an attack
0 - False 1 - True. If we use the extra blocks system for duels, only when both heroes are dismounted, else enabled for the mounted charge phase too
Chance of a brawl after the hero_duel_time_between_brawls has elapsed (0-1)
Max brawl time (seconds)
Min brawl time (seconds)
Chance of transitioning to a circle after a brawl (0-1)
Radius of the circle phase.
Chance of transitioning to a brawl after a circle (default: 0.55)
The turn amount the hero will travel when in the circle state (in radians, 2pi default: 6.2831)
Modifier to apply when calculating the base dismount chance (default: 1) (BASE CHANCE: attacking_hero_exp / attacked_hero_exp * damage_proportion * THIS)

Target at which the hero will be dismounted in a duel. This value will decay and each bit of damage done to the unit will sum towards this. Each successful strike done by this unit will replenish this target a bit (default: 0.6)
The amount per second that the hero_duel_dismount_target will reduce by (default: 0.004)
The amount that hero_duel_dismount_target will gain per successful strike (default: 0.008)
Bonus dismount chance modifier to apply to an un-mounted hero when facing a mounted hero. This is multiplied with the base chance calculated. (default: 5)
Distance to move after the charge phase (default: 17.5)
The amount of the percentage of remaining hp to remove when a killing blow is spared by the attacking hero in duel.
The absolute maximum time to allow in duel survival goal
The absolute minimum time to allow in duel survival goal
The time (seconds) to elapse in a duel until a dismount chance is allowed. 0 == can dismount anytime
Min time between brawl phases (default: 30)
Entities with this many hitpoints or less will fall through hard collision (e.g. over ledges, cliffs, etc)
for pikes - time before the same defender can be attacked by the same pikeman
for pikes - multiplied to damage result from combat rules to determine final pike damage
for pikes - chance of triggering a knockback on hitting
for pikes - multiplied to bearing_relative_speed between defender and pikeman to determine pike damage bonus
attacker/defender mass ratio where no hit reactions will be triggered by rules
attacker/defender mass ratio where no knock backs will be triggered by rules, or cascading
attacker/defender mass ratio where no knock downs will be triggered by rules, or cascading
attacker/defender mass ratio where no melee blocks will be triggered by rules
attacker/defender mass ratio where no step backs will be triggered by rules, or cascading
chance to trigger a jumping attack instead of a moving attack
chance to trigger a jumping attack instead of a moving attack for small groups / units / heroes
chance to trigger a jumping attack instead of a moving attack against a unit having charge reflection
chance to trigger a jumping attack instead of a moving attack against a routing unit (applied for small groups / units / heroes as well)
multiplied to the armour stat and then added to the randomised delay time generated from the randomiser
maximum delay time for randomiser
minimum delay time for randomiser
Percentage chance of using matched combat instead of async attacks for melee combat, for hero_vs_hero when at least one of them is cavalry.
Percentage chance of using matched combat instead of async attacks for melee combat, for hero_vs_hero when both are infantry.
Percentage chance of using matched combat instead of async attacks for melee combat, for hero_vs_units.
Percentage hit points remaining required to initiate matched combat.
When taking damage from sources not in the same combat witness, remaining hit points is clamped to this value to prevent entity from dying and prematurely terminating matched combat.
Percentage chance of using matched combat instead of async attacks for melee combat
Percentage chance of using matched combat instead of async attacks for melee combat, for units_vs_heroes.
The maximum number of bastion artillery pieces the defender can have in a siege. Each settlement must have at LEAST this many slots, it can have more.
delay after weapon hit before the next attack animation can start
Modifier applied to the number of entities in a unit to calculate how many entities have to be in combat to react, for artillery units
Modifier applied to the number of entities in a unit to calculate how many entities have to be in combat to react, when the unit is in guard mode

Modifier applied to the number of entities in a unit to calculate how many entities have to be in combat to react, when the unit is idle AND has ammo AND unit missile weapon is not precursor AND unit has fire at will
Modifier applied to the number of entities in a unit to calculate how many entities have to be in combat to react, default modifier
Modifier applied to the number of entities in a unit to calculate how many entities have to be in combat to react, when the unit is not idle
coefficient by which defender's melee defence stat is multiplied by when attacked in the flank
coefficient by which defender's melee defence stat is multiplied by when attacked in the rear
Added to base defend stat if defender is in formed attack.
used in melee height damage modifier calculation
used in melee height damage modifier calculation
base melee hit chance, used in attack hit determination
max melee hit chance, used in attack hit determination
min melee hit chance, used in attack hit determination
coefficient by which hit chance determination calculation is normalised

A hybrid melee-mage will casts spells unit the mana pool is this many seconds away from filling up to max (at base mana recharge rate.) After this point it will favor melee attack, until mana is no long so low.
Maximum number of hit reaction interrupts before entity ignores hit reactions to allow it the opportunity to attack (for regulars)
Maximum number of hit reaction interrupts before entity ignores hit reactions to allow it the opportunity to attack (for hero vs hero)
Maximum number of hit reaction interrupts before entity ignores hit reactions to allow it the opportunity to attack (for heroes)
Multiplied to base knock probabilities and charging factor to get bonus to add to knock chance when attacker is charging
Multiplier to knock chance when defender is charging
Multiplied to mass ratio (attacker/defender) to get base knockback probability on a melee hit
Multiplied to mass ratio (attacker/defender) to get base knockdown probability on a melee hit
penalty multiplier applied to melee defence of entity who is attacked by multiple attackers
the probability in range [0, 1] that a secondary melee attacker will be awarded an attack
This multiplier is applied to the primary melee weapon damage when attacking buildings.
The minimum possible melee attack interval in seconds. Dictates the fastest speed at which entities can fight. Needed because stat can max out, leading to a time of 0s
Accuracy to use for arrow/cannon towers, when there are no entity stats.
multiplied by armour value during missile damage resolution
multiplied by armour value during missile damage resolution
used in missile height damage calculations
used in missile height damage calculations
Entities in own unit will be excluded from clear shot test and projectile collisions.
used to determine letthality of projectile due to range, when target is within effective range
used to determine letthality of projectile due to range, once the projectile exceeds effective range
basic saving bonus to which shields and armour bonuses are added
the sum of the armour and shield bonuses are multiplied by this value.
multiplied by shield value during missile damage resolution
subtracted from hit chance in range [0, 1] when determine missile's accuracy against target in cover
Minimum value the move backwards extent can be reduced to
Minimum value the move backwards extent during melee can be reduced to
Maximum seconds the entity can_move backwards from melee - used with walk speed to create radius of valid movement area
Maximum seconds the entity can_move backwards for - used with walk speed to create radius of valid movement area
Move backwards at this percentage of their walk_speed
The degrees creating the move backwards valid movement area
Unit record max visibility spotting range for attacking units in a night battle. Result will be THIS * m_visibility_spotting_range
Unit record max visibility spotting range for attacking units in a night battle. Result will be THIS * m_visibility_spotting_range
Pike attack cone in front of entity, in cosine(angle), e.g. cos(60) = 0.5
Pike attack cone depth (m)
Bearing delta from movement direction to lower or raise pikes (radians)
Once locked in combat animation, this timer is set. Timer must run out before entity can lower pike.

Timer is set as long as entity bearing is not within pike_lower_bearing_tolerance. Timer must run out before entity can lower pike. This is a value multiplied to (Pi/turn rate), i.e. the time to do an about turn.
Introduce a random aim point error based on the radius or height of the target multiplied by this number.
Specifies the chance of the damaging arrow being deflected onto the ground for hero entities (otherwise it will be visually stuck on the entity). It will always stick on dead heroes
Specifies the chance of the damaging arrow being deflected onto the ground for regular entities (otherwise it will be visually stuck on the entity). It will always stick on dead entities
Used to modify the target area for tower projectiles when against a single entity general unit

Friendly entities are enlarged by this co-efficient to make them fatter and harder to fire past. Be wary with reducing this. It was added to deal with exploit where players would put melee 'shield' units in front of their missile units and fire through them (Original value: 1.3)

Friendly entities are enlarged by this co-efficient to make them fatter and harder to fire past. Be wary with reducing this. It was added to deal with exploit where players would put melee 'shield' units in front of their missile units and fire through them (Original value: 2.2)
Used to modify the target area for projectiles when against a single entity general unit
All attacks from pursuers against routers are treated as charges (get the charge bonus * pursuit_charge_bonus_modifier )
This value multiplied by the entity radius is the distance threshold used for reforms
Cavalry refusal chance vs units with charge negation
Cavalry refusal chance vs heroes
Cavalry refusal chance vs pike phalanx
For charge reflections, this value will be used as the mass ratio
For charge reflections involving single entity heroes as the charger, this value will be used as the mass ratio
Playable area size scaled between min and max based on number of units
Playable area size scaled between min and max based on number of units
Penalty which grows from zero to max as the settlement is destroyed
Penalty which grows from zero to max as the settlement is destroyed
Shield defense half-angle vs melee (deg)
Shield defense half-angle vs missile (deg)
Shield defense half-angle vs missile (deg), 180 is protected from all angles
instantaneous speed delta to trigger a knocked back interrupt
instantaneous speed delta to trigger a knocked down interrupt
instantaneous speed delta to trigger a knocked flying interrupt
instantaneous speed delta to trigger a step back interrupt
default distance at which units can spot other units
spotting distance reduced when unit is hidden
If the value is 0 the HP will be stored at the composed entity group level (as defined in the land_units_templates table) otherwise they will be stored at the composed entity level.
Sets the number of tickets to be used in a battle with multiple capture points, i.e. medium. large and extra large cities
Sets the number of tickets to be used in a battle with a single capture point, i.e. small city, encampment, baggage train

The units rank depth at which we start to scale the decay modifier (Used for staggering unit movement). Will be used with unit_decay_scaling_starting_row to scale the decay value for the units max rows. Should be > unit_decay_scaling_starting_row

The units rank depth at which we start to scale the decay modifier (Used for staggering unit movement). Ranks below this will use the raw decay value, above this will use a percentage of this, calculated with unit_decay_scaling_ending_row. Should be < unit_decay_scaling_ending_row
When this ratio of the unit cannot see to fire, the unit's LOS is considered blocked
The value to be multiplied with the default unit rank depth to calculate the max drag width. Should be > 0
Maximum width in metres a unit can drag out to
The value to be multiplied with the default unit rank depth to calculate the min drag width. The result will scale with the entities remaining in the unit. Should be > 0
distance between unit spawn position and the ordered position

Given the difference in cp deltas between 2 units, anything +/- this fraction will be considered an even matchup. E.g. UnitA:100 UnitB:105 Ratio:0.952 -> if ratio is greater than 1 - unit_threat_considered_even_fraction and less than 1 + unit_threat_considered_even_fraction then its even
The range to detect enemies to contribute to unruly taunt.
The max number of enemies in range to allow the taunt meter to fill. If more than this then the unit will 'decide' it should not attack due to high loss probability.
The percentage health that must remain before a unit will consider going unruly (0.0 - 1.0).
The number of taunt points per battle tick per enemy in range to gain/lose.
The number of taunt points needed to go unruly. Taunt points are accumlated every battle tick.
The max number of taunt points to accumulate.
After this period of time a unit will come to its senses and become controllable again, even if still in battle. (battle tick)
Range at which hidden unspottable units are revealed
The maximum damage modification available
The minimum damage modification available
